info.title: Managing &systemd; targets with the systemctl command

abstract.para: &systemd;targets are special unit files that describe a system or synchronization state. They are used to group units together in order or bring the system to a certain state, just like other init systems use runlevels. You can use the systemctl command to manage &systemd; targets.
